00014 #include <string>

00016 #include <GeographicLib/Constants.hpp>
00017 #include <GeographicLib/CircularEngine.hpp>
00018 #include <GeographicLib/GravityModel.hpp>

00020 namespace GeographicLib {
00021 
00022   /**
00023    * \brief Gravity on a circle of latitude
00024    *
00025    * Evaluate the earth's gravity field on a circle of constant height and
00026    * latitude.  This uses a CircleEngine to pre-evaluate the inner sum of the
00027    * spherical harmonic sum, allowing the values of the field at several
00028    * different longitudes to be evaluated rapidly.
00029    *
00030    * Use GravityModel::Circle to create a GravityCircle object.  (The
00031    * constructor for this class is private.)
00032    *
00033    * See \ref gravityparallel for an example of using GravityCircle (together
00034    * with OpenMP) to speed up the computation of geoid heights.
00035    **********************************************************************/
00036 
00037   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT GravityCircle {
00038   private:
00039     typedef Math::real real;
00040     enum mask {
00041       NONE                 = GravityModel::NONE,
00042       GRAVITY              = GravityModel::GRAVITY,
00043       DISTURBANCE          = GravityModel::DISTURBANCE,
00044       DISTURBING_POTENTIAL = GravityModel::DISTURBING_POTENTIAL,
00045       GEOID_HEIGHT         = GravityModel::GEOID_HEIGHT,
00046       SPHERICAL_ANOMALY    = GravityModel::SPHERICAL_ANOMALY,
00047       ALL                  = GravityModel::ALL,
00048     };
00049 
00050     unsigned _caps;
00051     real _a, _f, _lat, _h, _Z, _P, _invR, _cpsi, _spsi,
00052       _cphi, _sphi, _amodel, _GMmodel, _dzonal0,
00053       _corrmult, _gamma0, _gamma, _frot;
00054     CircularEngine _gravitational, _disturbing, _correction;
00055 
00056     GravityCircle(mask caps, real a, real f, real lat, real h,
00057                   real Z, real P, real cphi, real sphi,
00058                   real amodel, real GMmodel, real dzonal0, real corrmult,
00059                   real gamma0, real gamma, real frot,
00060                   const CircularEngine& gravitational,
00061                   const CircularEngine& disturbing,
00062                   const CircularEngine& correction)
00063       : _caps(caps)
00064       , _a(a)
00065       , _f(f)
00066       , _lat(lat)
00067       , _h(h)
00068       , _Z(Z)
00069       , _P(P)
00070       , _invR(Math::hypot(_P, _Z))
00071       , _cpsi(_P * _invR)
00072       , _spsi(_Z * _invR)
00073       , _cphi(cphi)
00074       , _sphi(sphi)
00075       , _amodel(amodel)
00076       , _GMmodel(GMmodel)
00077       , _dzonal0(dzonal0)
00078       , _corrmult(corrmult)
00079       , _gamma0(gamma0)
00080       , _gamma(gamma)
00081       , _frot(frot)
00082       , _gravitational(gravitational)
00083       , _disturbing(disturbing)
00084       , _correction(correction)
00085     {}
00086 
00087     friend class GravityModel; // GravityModel calls the private constructor
00088     Math::real W(real clam, real slam,
00089                  real& gX, real& gY, real& gZ) const throw();
00090     Math::real V(real clam, real slam,
00091                  real& gX, real& gY, real& gZ) const throw();
00092     Math::real InternalT(real clam, real slam,
00093                          real& deltaX, real& deltaY, real& deltaZ,
00094                          bool gradp, bool correct) const throw();
00095   public:
00096     /**
00097      * A default constructor for the normal gravity.  This sets up an
00098      * uninitialized object which can be later replaced by the
00099      * GravityModel::Circle.
00100      **********************************************************************/
00101     GravityCircle() : _a(-1) {}
00102 
00103     /** \name Compute the gravitational field
00104      **********************************************************************/
00105     ///@{
00106     /**
00107      * Evaluate the gravity.
00108      *
00109      * @param[in] lon the geographic longitude (degrees).
00110      * @param[out] gx the easterly component of the acceleration
00111      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00112      * @param[out] gy the northerly component of the acceleration
00113      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00114      * @param[out] gz the upward component of the acceleration
00115      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>); this is usually negative.
00116      * @return \e W the sum of the gravitational and centrifugal potentials.
00117      *
00118      * The function includes the effects of the earth's rotation.
00119      **********************************************************************/
00120     Math::real Gravity(real lon, real& gx, real& gy, real& gz) const throw();
00121 
00122     /**
00123      * Evaluate the gravity disturbance vector.
00124      *
00125      * @param[in] lon the geographic longitude (degrees).
00126      * @param[out] deltax the easterly component of the disturbance vector
00127      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00128      * @param[out] deltay the northerly component of the disturbance vector
00129      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00130      * @param[out] deltaz the upward component of the disturbance vector
00131      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00132      * @return \e T the corresponding disturbing potential.
00133      **********************************************************************/
00134     Math::real Disturbance(real lon, real& deltax, real& deltay, real& deltaz)
00135       const throw();
00136 
00137     /**
00138      * Evaluate the geoid height.
00139      *
00140      * @param[in] lon the geographic longitude (degrees).
00141      * @return \e N the height of the geoid above the reference ellipsoid
00142      *   (meters).
00143      *
00144      * Some approximations are made in computing the geoid height so that the
00145      * results of the NGA codes are reproduced accurately.  Details are given
00146      * in \ref gravitygeoid.
00147      **********************************************************************/
00148     Math::real GeoidHeight(real lon) const throw();
00149 
00150     /**
00151      * Evaluate the components of the gravity anomaly vector using the
00152      * spherical approximation.
00153      *
00154      * @param[in] lon the geographic longitude (degrees).
00155      * @param[out] Dg01 the gravity anomaly (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00156      * @param[out] xi the northerly component of the deflection of the vertical
00157      *  (degrees).
00158      * @param[out] eta the easterly component of the deflection of the vertical
00159      *  (degrees).
00160      *
00161      * The spherical approximation (see Heiskanen and Moritz, Sec 2-14) is used
00162      * so that the results of the NGA codes are reproduced accurately.
00163      * approximations used here.  Details are given in \ref gravitygeoid.
00164      **********************************************************************/
00165     void SphericalAnomaly(real lon, real& Dg01, real& xi, real& eta)
00166       const throw();
00167 
00168     /**
00169      * Evaluate the components of the acceleration due to gravity and the
00170      * centrifugal acceleration in geocentric coordinates.
00171      *
00172      * @param[in] lon the geographic longitude (degrees).
00173      * @param[out] gX the \e X component of the acceleration
00174      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00175      * @param[out] gY the \e Y component of the acceleration
00176      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00177      * @param[out] gZ the \e Z component of the acceleration
00178      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00179      * @return \e W = \e V + \e Phi the sum of the gravitational and
00180      *   centrifugal potentials (m<sup>2</sup> s<sup>-2</sup>).
00181      **********************************************************************/
00182     Math::real W(real lon, real& gX, real& gY, real& gZ) const throw() {
00183       real clam, slam;
00184       CircularEngine::cossin(lon, clam, slam);
00185       return W(clam, slam, gX, gY, gZ);
00186     }
00187 
00188     /**
00189      * Evaluate the components of the acceleration due to gravity in geocentric
00190      * coordinates.
00191      *
00192      * @param[in] lon the geographic longitude (degrees).
00193      * @param[out] GX the \e X component of the acceleration
00194      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00195      * @param[out] GY the \e Y component of the acceleration
00196      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00197      * @param[out] GZ the \e Z component of the acceleration
00198      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00199      * @return \e V = \e W - \e Phi the gravitational potential
00200      *   (m<sup>2</sup> s<sup>-2</sup>).
00201      **********************************************************************/
00202     Math::real V(real lon, real& GX, real& GY, real& GZ) const throw() {
00203       real clam, slam;
00204       CircularEngine::cossin(lon, clam, slam);
00205       return V(clam, slam, GX, GY, GZ);
00206     }
00207 
00208 
00209     /**
00210      * Evaluate the components of the gravity disturbance in geocentric
00211      * coordinates.
00212      *
00213      * @param[in] lon the geographic longitude (degrees).
00214      * @param[out] deltaX the \e X component of the gravity disturbance
00215      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00216      * @param[out] deltaY the \e Y component of the gravity disturbance
00217      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00218      * @param[out] deltaZ the \e Z component of the gravity disturbance
00219      *   (m s<sup>-2</sup>).
00220      * @return \e T = \e W - \e U the disturbing potential (also called the
00221      *   anomalous potential) (m<sup>2</sup> s<sup>-2</sup>).
00222      **********************************************************************/
00223     Math::real T(real lon, real& deltaX, real& deltaY, real& deltaZ)
00224       const throw() {
00225       real clam, slam;
00226       CircularEngine::cossin(lon, clam, slam);
00227       return InternalT(clam, slam, deltaX, deltaY, deltaZ, true, true);
00228     }
00229 
00230     /**
00231      * Evaluate disturbing potential in geocentric coordinates.
00232      *
00233      * @param[in] lon the geographic longitude (degrees).
00234      * @return \e T = \e W - \e U the disturbing potential (also called the
00235      *   anomalous potential) (m<sup>2</sup> s<sup>-2</sup>).
00236      **********************************************************************/
00237     Math::real T(real lon) const throw() {
00238       real clam, slam, dummy;
00239       CircularEngine::cossin(lon, clam, slam);
00240       return InternalT(clam, slam, dummy, dummy, dummy, false, true);
00241     }
00242 
00243     ///@}
00244 
00245     /** \name Inspector functions
00246      **********************************************************************/
00247     ///@{
00248     /**
00249      * @return true if the object has been initialized.
00250      **********************************************************************/
00251     bool Init() const throw() { return _a > 0; }
00252 
00253     /**
00254      * @return \e a the equatorial radius of the ellipsoid (meters).  This is
00255      *   the value inherited from the GravityModel object used in the
00256      *   constructor.
00257      **********************************************************************/
00258     Math::real MajorRadius() const throw()
00259     { return Init() ? _a : Math::NaN<real>(); }
00260 
00261     /**
00262      * @return \e f the flattening of the ellipsoid.  This is the value
00263      *   inherited from the GravityModel object used in the constructor.
00264      **********************************************************************/
00265     Math::real Flattening() const throw()
00266     { return Init() ? _f : Math::NaN<real>(); }
00267 
00268     /**
00269      * @return the latitude of the circle (degrees).
00270      **********************************************************************/
00271     Math::real Latitude() const throw()
00272     { return Init() ? _lat : Math::NaN<real>(); }
00273 
00274     /**
00275      * @return the height of the circle (meters).
00276      **********************************************************************/
00277     Math::real Height() const throw()
00278     { return Init() ? _h : Math::NaN<real>(); }
00279 
00280     /**
00281      * @return \e caps the computational capabilities that this object was
00282      *   constructed with.
00283      **********************************************************************/
00284     unsigned Capabilities() const throw() { return _caps; }
00285 
00286     /**
00287      * @param[in] testcaps a set of bitor'ed GeodesicLine::mask values.
00288      * @return true if the GeodesicLine object has all these capabilities.
00289      **********************************************************************/
00290     bool Capabilities(unsigned testcaps) const throw() {
00291       return (_caps & testcaps) == testcaps;
00292     }
00293     ///@}
00294   };
00295 
00296 } // namespace GeographicLib
